definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: cut in, engrave, plough, devise (NH id., plough, so Eth h.arasa: Ph. [[חרש]], Aram. (rare) [[חֲרַת]] engrave, h.rat cleave, plough, Ar. h.ara3a plough)—
cut in, engrave, of worker in metals [[נְחשֶׁת וּבַרְזֶל]] ´[[ח]] Ge 4:22 (J), [[נחשׁת]] ´[[ח]] 1Ki 7:14; fig. [[עַל־לוּחַ לִבָּם]] ´[[ח]] Je 17:1 engraved on the tablet of their heart.

plough, lit., human subj. (animal usu. c. [[בְּ]]), no obj. expr. 1Ki 19:19, De 22:10, Is 28:24, so [[יַחֲרוֹשׁ בבקרים]] Am 6:12 (but rd. prob. [[יֵחָרֵשׁ בבקר יׇם]], v. We al.); c. acc. cogn. [[חֲרִישׁוֹ]] ´[[ח]] 1Sa 8:12 plough his ploughing (= do his ploughing), Pr 20:4; fig. of Judah Ho 10:11; with ethical ref. [[רֶשַׁע]] ´[[ח]] v:Ho 10:13 (‖[[קחר]]), [[אָיֶן]] ´[[ח]] Job 4:8 (‖[[זרע]], [[קחר]]); [[עַל־גַּבִּי חָֽרְשׁוּ חׂרְשִׁים]] Ps 129:3 upon my back have ploughmen ploughed (fig. of oppression by wicked); [[חׂרֵשׁ]] = ploughman Is 28:24, Am 9:13 (‖[[קוֹחֵר]]); ´[[ח]] with oxen subj. only Job 1:14.

devise (as one who works in, practises), usu. bad sense, obj. [[רָעָה]] Pr 3:29, [[רַע]] Pr 6:14; [[מַחְשְׁבוֹת אָוֶן]] v:Pr 6:18, [[חׂרְשֵׁי רַע]] Pr 12:20, Pr 14:22; but also [[חׂרְשֵׁי טוֹב]] v:Pr 14:22.

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Impf. 3 fs. [[חִיּוֹן שָׂדֶה תֵּחָרֵשׁ]] Mic 3:12 Zion, as a field she shall be ploughed = Je 26:18.

definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: Pt. [[מַחֲרִישׁ רָעָה עַל־]] 1Sa 23:9 fabricating mischief against (v. Dr, and cf. We).
